info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 02 at 12:18PM PDT until August 02 at 2:15PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR SAN BERNARDINO COUNTY... At 1218 PM PDT, Thunderstorms produced heavy rain across the southern York Fire burn scar. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain fell over the burn scar. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... the York Fire Burn Scar in San Bernardino County Although the storm producing rainfall has diminished, flooding and debris flows remain a threat. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry washes is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas.
